intro: Argostemma calycinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
